content:
hello,
im trying to include code listings in my LaTeX Document with unicode Symbols that are "not set up for use with LaTex". For example the symbol '⇑'.
from some stackoverflow thread i came to this solution 

\newunicodechar{⇑}{\ensuremath{\Uparrow}}

however this solution seems to be pretty wanky, it displays the symbol wrong if it occurs near parantheses. also this dosnt work for non latex symbols like '⨳'.
is there a better way to print those symbols?

https://tex.stackexchange.com/a/34609
This answer works for me. If you import these packages you can just use the unicode character in latex and it doesn't complain.
Simon Daniel has marked this topic as resolved.
